description: From Middle French imprudent, from Latin imprūdens (“not foreseeing, ignorant”), prefix im- (“not”) + prūdens (“foreseeing, skilled, judicious”).

adjectives.description: imprudent (comparative more imprudent, superlative most imprudent)

entries.meaning: Not prudent; lacking prudence or discretion; indiscreet; injudicious; not paying attention to the consequences of one's actions
examples: Synonyms: indiscreet, injudicious, incautious, ill-advised, unwise, heedless, careless, rash, negligent
